markdown:
When great heroes or other powerful individuals encounter misfortune and die at sea or to other water-related accidents, the anguished soul sometimes clings to its corpse, creating a drenchdead. Drenchdead prefer to lurk in water and attack from ambush, giving victims the same deadly surprise that led to their own deaths. A drenchdead can manipulate water to drown a victim directly but prefers to draw out this suffering. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 32 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27 [Drenchdead](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1662) **Source** [Pathfinder #172: Secrets of the Temple City](/Sources.aspx?ID=102) pg. 81 **Perception** +21; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [wavesense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=41) (precise) 60 feet **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1); (can't speak any language) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +21, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +25, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +23, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +19 **Str** +7 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** +0 **Wis** +1 **Cha** +3 --- **AC** 32 **Fort** +24 **Ref** +21 **Will** +19 **HP** 230 **Immunities** [death](/Domains.aspx?ID=7) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) **Resistances** [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27) 10 --- **Speed** 20 feet, swim 35 feet **Melee** claw +26 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 3d6+13 slashing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **Melee** jaws +26, **Damage** 3d10+13 piercing **Aquatic Camouflage** When fully submerged in water, the drenchdead can [Hide](/Actions.aspx?ID=62) from other creatures even if it doesn't have cover against them and isn't [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) from them. **Drag Down** **Requirements** The drenchdead is swimming in water at least 10 feet deep; **Effect** The drenchdead attempts an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check to [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=35) an adjacent creature (on nearby land or in the water). On a success against a creature on land, in addition to the normal effects of Grapple, the drenchdead pulls the creature into the water into a space adjacent to itself. If the creature is already in the water, on a success, in addition the normal effects of Grapple, the drenchdead drags the creature 10 feet deeper, moving 10 feet with the creature. Moving a creature into water or deeper into water using Drag Down is [forced movement](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) for the target creature, but not for the drenchdead. **Drowning Touch** ([Conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33), [Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165)) The drenchdead touches a creature and causes water from its own body to flow into the creature's lungs. If the creature can't breathe water, it must attempt a DC 32 Fortitude save.
**Success** The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Drowning Touch for 24 hours.
**Failure** The creature becomes [sickened 3](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34).
**Critical Failure** The creature chokes on the water and runs out of air. It falls [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) and starts [drowning](/Rules.aspx?ID=468). If the creature is above water, it recovers from drowning as soon as it succeeds at a saving throw against suffocation. **Surface Skimmer** A drenchdead submerged in water has cover from attacks made by creatures out of the water.
Drenchdead on Golarion Drenchdead are common along coasts but are particularly prevalent in the Shackles and near the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. Great pirates might meet their death at [Besmara's](/Deities.aspx?ID=57) hands just as they were returning home with a massive haul of treasure, or viking raiders could die on their journey across the ocean toward Vallenhall. These proud heroes might rise as [draugr](/Monsters.aspx?ID=642) or other [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160), but the most notable heroes of all become drenchdead.
name: Drenchdead
